page.title: 02LOVERSALL CHURCH
page.content: Loversall is a very old church, it is even mentioned in the Domesday book,it is about 900 years old. It is made out of local Limestone. Loversall church needs a lot of repairs because it was broken into a few months ago. They did not take much, just a few candles, but they did break a stained glass window. Just as you come into the church door there is a font where babies are christened. The floor of the church is stone with a red carpet down the middle. There are two services every Sunday, one where older people go and another where children go, called Sunday School. The church needs repairing, some of the slates are falling off. Not long ago we had a Flower Festival which lasted three days over the Whitsun Bank Holiday. Nearly everything in the church is original,that is about 11th century.
